Instructions: Cook oatmeal according to package instructions. Top with sliced apples and crushed almonds. Serve warm.
Grill or bake salmon until cooked through. Steam broccoli until tender. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Serve salmon over a bed of quinoa with steamed broccoli on the side.

Recipe: Black Bean and Kale Salad with Avocado Dressing
Instructions: Mix cooked black beans and chopped kale in a bowl. Blend avocado with lime juice, garlic, and salt until smooth to make the dressing. Toss the salad with the avocado dressing and serve.
Cook lentils in vegetable broth until tender. Add chopped spinach and simmer until wilted. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
Blend blueberries, walnuts, Greek yogurt, and honey with almond milk until smooth. Adjust sweetness to taste. Enjoy as a refreshing breakfast or snack.

Recipe: Cauliflower Rice Stir-Fry with Orange Glazed Tofu
Instructions: Grate cauliflower into rice-like grains. Stir-fry cauliflower rice with diced tofu and orange segments in a skillet. Drizzle with a mixture of orange juice, soy sauce, and honey. Cook until heated through. Serve hot.

Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Roast bell peppers, zucchini, cherry tomatoes, and red onion in the oven with olive oil, salt, and pepper until tender. Toss cooked quinoa with roasted vegetables, crumbled feta cheese, and a drizzle of balsamic vinegar. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Marinate chicken breast in olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, salt, and pepper for at least 30 minutes. Grill chicken until cooked through. Grill asparagus spears until tender. Serve grilled chicken breast with grilled asparagus on the side.

Mix cooked chickpeas, diced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, thinly sliced red onion, pitted and sliced kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese in a bowl. Dress with olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Toss to combine. Serve chilled.

Drain canned tuna and cannellini beans. Flake tuna with a fork and mix with drained beans in a bowl. Add diced red bell pepper, chopped celery, thinly sliced red onion, and chopped parsley. Dress with lemon juice, olive oil, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper. Toss to combine. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Press tofu to remove excess moisture, then cut into cubes. Stir-fry tofu in sesame oil with minced garlic and ginger until golden brown. Add sliced bok choy and cook until wilted. Mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, and cornstarch in a bowl, then pour over tofu and bok choy. Cook until sauce thickens. Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds. Serve hot.

Ingredients: Assorted roasted vegetables (such as bell peppers, zucchini, eggplant)
Instructions: Spread hummus evenly on whole wheat tortillas. Top with assorted roasted vegetables, baby spinach leaves, thinly sliced red onion, sun-dried tomatoes, and crumbled feta cheese if desired. Roll up tightly to form wraps. Serve immediately or wrap in foil for later.

Marinate chicken thighs in soy sauce, vinegar, minced garlic, bay leaves, black peppercorns, and sugar for at least 30 minutes. Simmer in the marinade until chicken is cooked through and sauce is reduced. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Boil shrimp with tamarind soup base, sliced tomatoes, chopped onions, sliced radish, and string beans until shrimp is pink and vegetables are tender. Add spinach and simmer until wilted. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Boil Canton noodles until tender, then drain and set aside. Stir-fry sliced chicken breast, shrimp, julienned carrots, shredded cabbage, sliced bell peppers, chopped onions, and minced garlic in soy sauce and oyster sauce until cooked through. Add cooked noodles and toss until well combined. Serve hot.

Sauté sliced ginger, minced garlic, and chopped onion in a pot until fragrant. Add chicken pieces and cook until browned. Pour in water and bring to a boil. Add sliced chayote and simmer until chicken is tender and chayote is cooked through. Season with fish sauce. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Serve hot.

Sauté minced garlic and chopped onion in a pan until golden brown. Add cleaned and chopped water spinach (kangkong) and cook until wilted. Pour in soy sauce, vinegar, and black peppercorns. Simmer until flavors meld. Serve hot as a side dish.
Drain canned fruit cocktail, nata de coco, and kaong. Mix with macapuno in a bowl. Add condensed milk and all-purpose cream. Stir until well combined. Chill in the refrigerator before serving.

Sauté minced garlic and chopped onion in a pot until fragrant. Add diced squash, sliced string beans, sliced eggplant, sliced okra, and chopped bok choy. Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Stir in shrimp paste. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Serve hot with rice.

Sauté sliced ginger, minced garlic, chopped onion, and chili peppers in a pot until fragrant. Add cleaned mussels and cook until shells open. Pour in water and bring to a boil. Season with fish sauce. Add spinach and simmer until wilted. Serve hot.

Boil pork ribs with tamarind soup base, sliced tomatoes, sliced radish, sliced eggplant, and string beans until pork is tender and vegetables are cooked through. Add spinach and simmer until wilted. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Mix ground pork with finely grated carrots, minced onion, minced garlic, beaten egg, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Wrap the pork mixture in spring roll wrappers and seal with beaten egg. Fry in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with sweet chili sauce for dipping.

Sauté minced garlic, chopped onion, and sliced ginger in a pan until fragrant. Add sliced bitter melon, diced eggplant, diced squash, sliced string beans, and chopped tomatoes. Cook until vegetables are tender. Stir in shrimp paste and pork belly (if using). Simmer for a few minutes. Serve hot with rice.

Grill or roast eggplants until skin is charred and flesh is soft. Peel off the skin and flatten the eggplants. Beat eggs and season with salt and pepper. Dip each eggplant in beaten eggs, then fry in hot oil until golden brown and cooked through. Serve hot with diced tomatoes and onions on top.
Boil corn kernels in coconut milk until tender. Stir in sugar and salt to taste. Simmer until coconut milk thickens. Serve hot as a dessert or snack.

Sauté sliced ginger, minced garlic, chopped onion, and chili peppers in a pot until fragrant. Add cleaned mussels and cook until shells open. Pour in water and bring to a boil. Season with fish sauce. Add spinach and simmer until wilted. Serve hot.

Boil pork ribs with tamarind soup base, sliced tomatoes, sliced radish, sliced eggplant, and string beans until pork is tender and vegetables are cooked through. Add spinach and simmer until wilted. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Mix ground pork with finely grated carrots, minced onion, minced garlic, beaten egg, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Wrap the pork mixture in spring roll wrappers and seal with beaten egg. Fry in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with sweet chili sauce for dipping.

Sauté minced garlic, chopped onion, and sliced ginger in a pan until fragrant. Add sliced bitter melon, diced eggplant, diced squash, sliced string beans, and chopped tomatoes. Cook until vegetables are tender. Stir in shrimp paste and pork belly (if using). Simmer for a few minutes. Serve hot with rice.

Grill or roast eggplants until skin is charred and flesh is soft. Peel off the skin and flatten the eggplants. Beat eggs and season with salt and pepper. Dip each eggplant in beaten eggs, then fry in hot oil until golden brown and cooked through. Serve hot with diced tomatoes and onions on top.
Boil corn kernels in coconut milk until tender. Stir in sugar and salt to taste. Simmer until coconut milk thickens. Serve hot as a dessert or snack.

Sauté minced garlic and chopped onion in a pan until fragrant. Add sliced pork belly and cook until browned. Stir in coconut milk and shrimp paste. Simmer until pork is tender and sauce thickens. Add sliced green chili peppers and cook for a few more minutes. Serve hot with rice.
Boil chicken with ginger, garlic, and onion until tender. Add sliced papaya and chili leaves. Season with fish sauce. Simmer until papaya is cooked. Serve hot.

Sauté minced garlic, chopped onion, and sliced tomatoes until softened. Add sliced bottle gourd and cook until tender. Add shrimp if desired. Season with fish sauce. Cook until flavors meld. Serve hot.

Boil taro leaves in coconut milk until wilted and cooked. Sauté minced garlic, chopped onion, and chili peppers. Add shrimp paste and cooked taro leaves. Simmer until flavors blend. Serve hot with rice.

Recipe: Paksiw na Bangus (Milkfish Stewed in Vinegar)
Instructions: Clean and slice milkfish. Combine vinegar, minced garlic, sliced ginger, peppercorns, and chili peppers in a pot. Add milkfish slices and sliced eggplant. Simmer until fish is cooked and sauce thickens. Serve hot.

Recipe: Tortang Talong with Giniling (Eggplant Omelette with Ground Pork)
Instructions: Grill or roast eggplants until skin is charred and flesh is soft. Peel off the skin and flatten the eggplants. Sauté ground pork with minced garlic, chopped onion, and diced tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Wrap pork mixture in grilled eggplants and dip in beaten eggs. Fry until golden brown. Serve hot.

Clean and gut tilapia. Stuff cavity with sliced tomatoes, chopped onion, sliced ginger, minced garlic, and chili peppers. Drizzle with calamansi juice. Season with salt and pepper. Wrap in banana leaves and grill until fish is cooked through. Serve hot.

Soak rice noodles in water until softened, then drain. Sauté sliced chicken breast, shrimp, julienned carrots, shredded cabbage, sliced bell peppers, chopped onion, and minced garlic in soy sauce and fish sauce until cooked through. Add soaked noodles and toss until well combined. Serve hot.

Recipe: Ginisang Ampalaya at Itlog (Sauteed Bitter Melon with Egg)
Instructions: Slice bitter melon and remove seeds. Soak in salted water for 10 minutes, then drain. Sauté sliced tomatoes, chopped onion, and minced garlic until softened. Add bitter melon slices and cook until tender. Season with salt and pepper. Pour beaten eggs over the bitter melon mixture and cook until set. Serve hot.

Recipe: Tinumok (Shrimp and Coconut Milk Taro Dumplings)
Instructions: Boil taro until soft, then mash. Sauté minced garlic, chopped onion, and chili peppers until fragrant. Add mashed taro and coconut milk. Simmer until mixture thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Form into dumplings and stuff with cooked shrimp. Steam until cooked through. Serve hot.

Boil young jackfruit until tender, then drain. Sauté minced garlic, chopped onion, and chili peppers until fragrant. Add boiled jackfruit and shrimp (if using). Pour in coconut milk and simmer until flavors meld. Season with salt. Serve hot.
Combine chopped vegetables and olives. Crumble feta cheese on top. Drizzle with olive oil, lemon juice, and sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Sauté chicken with green curry paste. Add coconut milk, bell peppers, and bamboo shoots. Simmer until chicken is cooked. Stir in Thai basil, fish sauce, and brown sugar. Serve hot with rice.
Blend vegetables, olive oil, vinegar, and bread until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Chill before serving.
Bring dashi broth to a boil. Dissolve miso paste in the broth. Add cubed tofu and soaked wakame seaweed. Simmer until heated through. Garnish with sliced green onions.
Sauté onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili. Add spices and cook until fragrant. Stir in chickpeas and diced tomatoes. Simmer until flavors meld. Finish with lemon juice and chopped cilantro.
Arrange sliced mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil leaves on a plate. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Sauté sliced vegetables in olive oil with fajita seasoning until tender. Squeeze lime juice over the veggies. Serve with warm tortillas, sliced avocado, and salsa.
Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger. Add spices and cook until fragrant. Stir in chickpeas, diced tomatoes, and lemon slices. Simmer until chickpeas are tender. Garnish with fresh cilantro.
Soak rice paper wrappers in warm water until pliable. Fill with shrimp, noodles, lettuce, cucumber, carrot, and herbs. Roll tightly and serve with peanut sauce.
Cook black beans with pork loin, sausage, onion, garlic, bay leaves, and orange zest until beans are tender and flavors meld. Serve hot with rice and garnish with cilantro.

Mix ground beef, ground pork, breadcrumbs, egg, minced onion, minced garlic, allspice, and nutmeg. Form into meatballs and fry until browned. Make gravy with beef broth, cream, butter, and flour. Serve meatballs with gravy, lingonberry jam, and boiled potatoes.

Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Let it cool. Mix cooked quinoa with diced cucumber, tomato, red onion, olives, and crumbled feta cheese. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Season with salt, pepper, and chopped parsley. Serve chilled.

Heat sesame oil in a pan. Add minced garlic and ginger, stir-fry until fragrant. Add sliced vegetables and cook until tender-crisp. Mix soy sauce, water, and cornstarch, pour over the vegetables. Cook until sauce thickens. Serve hot with rice or noodles.

Recipe: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
Instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut a pocket into each chicken breast. Mix spinach, crumbled feta cheese, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Stuff the mixture into the chicken breasts. Secure with toothpicks. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and ginger in a pan. Add diced vegetables and cook until tender. Stir in curry powder, turmeric, and cayenne pepper. Add cubed tofu and coconut milk. Simmer until heated through. Finish with lime juice and chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a pie dish with pie crust. Sauté sliced mushrooms, chopped onion, and minced garlic until tender. Add baby spinach and cook until wilted. Whisk together eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Stir in shredded Swiss cheese. Pour into the pie crust. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until set.

Cook linguine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. Sauté minced garlic in butter and olive oil until fragrant. Add shrimp and cook until pink. Stir in lemon zest, lemon juice, red pepper flakes, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper. Toss with cooked pasta. Serve hot with grated Parmesan cheese.

Sauté diced onion, carrot, celery, and minced garlic until softened. Add lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, bay leaf, and thyme. Simmer until lentils are tender. Season with salt, pepper, and chopped parsley. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Mix honey, soy sauce, lemon juice, minced garlic, minced ginger, salt, and pepper. Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Brush with honey mixture. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until salmon is cooked through.
Layer Greek yogurt, granola, and mixed berries in a glass. Drizzle with honey. Repeat layers. Serve chilled.

Cook basmati rice until almost done. Sauté sliced onion, minced ginger, minced garlic, and green chili until golden. Add mixed vegetables and cook until tender. Stir in diced tomato, cumin seeds, cinnamon, cloves, bay leaf, turmeric, coriander powder, and garam masala. Layer cooked rice and vegetable mixture in a pot. Top with yogurt, mint leaves, and chopped cilantro. Cover and cook until rice is fully cooked. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Roll out puff pastry and place on a baking sheet. Score a border around the edges. Arrange sliced vegetables on top of the puff pastry. Drizzle with olive oil, balsamic vinegar, minced garlic, fresh thyme leaves, salt, and pepper. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until pastry is golden brown.

Press tofu to remove excess water, then cut into cubes. Sauté cubed tofu until golden brown. Add sliced vegetables and cook until tender-crisp. Mix teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, cornstarch, and water. Pour over the tofu and vegetables. Cook until sauce thickens. Serve hot with rice or noodles.

Remove stems from portobello mushrooms and clean them. Brush with olive oil, season with salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes. Fill each mushroom with sliced tomato, fresh mozzarella cheese, and basil leaves. Drizzle with balsamic glaze. Bake for an additional 5 minutes until cheese melts. Serve hot.

Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, sliced bell pepper, and diced tomato in a large paella pan until softened. Stir in arborio rice, saffron, paprika, salt, and pepper. Add vegetable broth and bring to a simmer. Arrange artichoke hearts, green beans, and peas on top of the rice mixture. Cover and cook until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. Sauté diced tofu, minced garlic, and sliced scallions until tofu is golden. Push tofu to the side and scramble the egg in the same pan. Add cooked noodles, bean sprouts, chopped peanuts, soy sauce, tamarind paste, sugar, and chili flakes. Stir-fry until heated through. Serve hot with lime wedges.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Thinly slice vegetables. Arrange sliced vegetables in a baking dish in an alternating pattern. Drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with minced garlic, fresh thyme leaves, salt, and pepper. Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes. Remove foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes until vegetables are tender. Garnish with fresh basil. Serve hot.

Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and sliced bell pepper until softened. Add diced tomatoes, drained kidney beans, drained black beans, chili powder, cumin, oregano, vegetable broth, and corn. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with diced avocado, chopped cilantro, and lime wedges.

Sauté sliced onion, diced bell pepper, and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. Add diced tomatoes, paprika, cumin, and red pepper flakes. Simmer until tomatoes break down. Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into them. Cover and cook until eggs are set. Season with salt, pepper, and chopped parsley. Serve hot with crusty bread.

Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil and butter until translucent. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until tender. Stir in arborio rice and cook for 1-2 minutes. Deglaze the pan with white wine. Gradually add vegetable broth, stirring constantly until absorbed. Stir in grated Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, and chopped parsley. Serve hot.

Season tuna with salt and pepper. Sear in a hot pan for 2-3 minutes per side. Slice thinly. Arrange mixed greens on a plate. Top with sliced boiled potatoes, halved hard-boiled eggs, blanched green beans, halved cherry tomatoes, sliced Kalamata olives, and thinly sliced red onion. Drizzle with a dressing made from Dijon mustard, red wine vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.

Blend chickpeas, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, ground cumin, ground coriander, baking powder, flour, salt, and pepper until combined. Form into balls and flatten slightly. Fry until golden brown. Mix Greek yogurt, grated cucumber, lemon juice, chopped dill, salt, and pepper for tzatziki sauce. Serve falafel in pita bread with tzatziki sauce.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Slice the tops off red bell peppers and remove seeds. Sauté diced eggplant, diced zucchini, diced tomato, minced onion, and minced garlic until softened. Stir in olive oil, fresh thyme leaves, salt, and pepper. Spoon the ratatouille mixture into the bell peppers. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until peppers are tender. Serve hot.

Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. Sauté sliced vegetables and minced garlic in olive oil until tender-crisp. Toss cooked pasta with sautéed vegetables, chopped fresh basil, grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.

Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger until fragrant. Add diced tomatoes, sliced carrot, drained chickpeas, turmeric, cinnamon, cumin, coriander, and vegetable broth. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Stir in lemon zest, chopped dates, and chopped cilantro. Serve hot garnished with toasted almonds.

Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. Sauté sliced mushrooms and minced garlic in olive oil until tender. Mix ricotta cheese, grated Parmesan cheese, shredded mozzarella cheese, beaten egg, salt, and pepper. Layer lasagna noodles with marinara sauce, mushroom mixture, spinach, and cheese mixture. Repeat layers. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until bubbly.

Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger until softened. Add diced carrot and celery, curry powder, and red lentils. Cook until lentils are tender. Stir in coconut milk and vegetable broth. Simmer until heated through. Season with lime juice, chopped cilantro, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.

Cook sushi rice according to package instructions. Place a nori sheet on a bamboo sushi mat. Spread cooked rice evenly over the nori sheet, leaving a border at the top. Arrange sliced cucumber, julienne carrot, sliced avocado, and sliced bell pepper on the rice. Roll tightly using the sushi mat. Slice into pieces. Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

Slice bell peppers, onion, zucchini, yellow squash, and mushrooms. Sauté sliced vegetables and minced garlic in olive oil until tender-crisp. Stir in cumin, chili powder, and paprika. Squeeze lime juice over the vegetables. Serve hot with tortillas, guacamole, and salsa.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut the tops off bell peppers and remove seeds. Roast bell peppers for 15 minutes. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. Add cooked quinoa, drained black beans, corn, diced tomato, chili powder, cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper. Stir in shredded cheddar cheese and chopped cilantro. Stuff mixture into roasted bell peppers. Bake for an additional 15 minutes or until peppers are tender.

Cook short-grain rice according to package instructions. Divide cooked rice among bowls. Sauté julienned carrot, blanched spinach, sliced zucchini, and blanched bean sprouts separately in sesame oil and minced garlic. Fry an egg sunny-side-up. Arrange cooked vegetables and fried egg on top of the rice. Serve with a mixture of soy sauce, sesame oil, and gochujang. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Cook oats in almond milk until creamy. Top with fresh berries, a sprinkle of cinnamon, and a drizzle of honey.
Grill chicken breast until cooked through. Slice and serve on a bed of mixed greens with sliced tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion. Drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette.
Stir-fry broccoli, sliced bell pepper, julienned carrot, snap peas, sliced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger in sesame oil. Add soy sauce and cook until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Allow to cool, then toss with diced cucumber, diced tomatoes, diced red onion, chopped parsley, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Mix cooked chickpeas with diced cucumber, diced tomatoes, diced red onion, crumbled feta cheese, halved Kalamata olives, olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.

Toss sliced carrots, broccoli florets, sliced zucchini, sliced bell peppers, and sliced red onion with olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Roast in the oven until vegetables are tender.
Layer Greek yogurt, fresh berries, and granola in a glass. Drizzle with honey.
Season salmon fillet with olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Grill until cooked through. Serve with grilled asparagus.

Slice eggplant and dip in beaten egg. Coat with breadcrumbs mixed with Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Bake until crispy. Layer with tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese. Bake until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and sliced bell pepper until softened. Add diced tomatoes, drained kidney beans, drained black beans, chili powder, cumin, oregano, vegetable broth, and corn. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with diced avocado, chopped cilantro, and lime wedges.
Slice tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese. Arrange on a plate with fresh basil leaves. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and extra virgin olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.

Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. Add diced bell peppers, diced tomatoes, trimmed green beans, drained artichoke hearts, rice, saffron, paprika, salt, and pepper. Stir in vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until rice is cooked. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened. Drain and set aside. Sauté sliced tofu, bean sprouts, julienned carrots, sliced bell pepper, and sliced green onions in olive oil until tender. Push vegetables to the side and scramble egg in the same pan. Add minced garlic and chopped peanuts. Stir in soaked rice noodles, soy sauce, tamarind paste, and sugar. Cook until heated through. Serve hot with lime wedges.

Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger until fragrant. Add diced potatoes, sliced carrots, diced bell peppers, and green peas. Stir in curry powder, coconut milk, and vegetable broth. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Serve hot over cooked rice. Garnish with chopped cilantro.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut the tops off bell peppers and remove seeds. Roast bell peppers for 15 minutes. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. Add cooked quinoa, drained black beans, corn, diced tomato, chili powder, cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper. Stir in shredded cheddar cheese and chopped cilantro. Stuff mixture into roasted bell peppers. Bake for an additional 15 minutes or until peppers are tender.

Cook short-grain rice according to package instructions. Divide cooked rice among bowls. Sauté julienned carrot, blanched spinach, sliced zucchini, and blanched bean sprouts separately in sesame oil and minced garlic. Fry an egg sunny-side-up. Arrange cooked vegetables and fried egg on top of the rice. Serve with a mixture of soy sauce, sesame oil, and gochujang. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Mix cooked chickpeas with diced cucumber, diced tomatoes, diced red onion, crumbled feta cheese, halved Kalamata olives, olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Toss cauliflower florets with olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Roast in the oven until golden brown and tender.

Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, sliced bell peppers, sliced mushrooms, and diced tomatoes until softened. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Beat eggs with grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. Pour over vegetables in the pan. Cook until the bottom is set, then transfer to the oven and broil until the top is golden brown and cooked through.

Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in butter until softened. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until browned. Stir in Arborio rice and cook for a few minutes. Add white wine and cook until absorbed. Gradually add vegetable broth, stirring constantly, until rice is creamy and cooked through. Stir in grated Parmesan cheese, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper.

Sauté diced onion, sliced bell pepper, and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. Add diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and red pepper flakes. Simmer until thickened. Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into them. Cover and cook until eggs are set. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with crusty bread.

Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, diced carrots, and diced celery until softened. Add lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, bay leaf, and thyme. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until lentils are tender. Season with salt and pepper.

Prepare sushi rice according to package instructions. Place a nori sheet on a bamboo mat. Spread rice over the nori, leaving a border along the edges. Arrange julienned cucumber, sliced avocado, matchstick carrots, sliced bell pepper, and sliced radish in the center. Roll tightly using the bamboo mat. Slice into rounds. Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.
Slice mango and avocado. Toss mixed greens with sliced red onion. Arrange mango and avocado slices on top. Whisk together lime juice, olive oil, honey, salt, and pepper. Drizzle over the salad.

Cook pasta according to package instructions. Rinse with cold water and drain. Toss with diced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, sliced red onion, halved Kalamata olives, crumbled feta cheese, olive oil, red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.

Cook lo mein noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. Sauté sliced bell peppers, julienned carrots, trimmed snow peas, sliced mushrooms, broccoli florets, sliced green onions, minced garlic, and grated ginger in sesame oil until tender-crisp. Toss with cooked noodles and soy sauce.
Slice cucumber, halve cherry tomatoes, and thinly slice red onion. Toss with balsamic vinegar, olive oil, honey, salt, and pepper.

Sauté sliced mushrooms, chopped spinach, diced red onion, and minced garlic in olive oil until vegetables are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Spread mixture over half of a flour tortilla. Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Fold tortilla in half. Cook in a skillet until golden brown on both sides.

Roll out pizza dough on a baking sheet. Spread tomato sauce over the dough. Top with shredded mozzarella cheese, sliced bell peppers, sliced red onion, sliced mushrooms, and chopped spinach. Drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Bake in a preheated oven according to dough instructions.

Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, diced carrots, and diced celery until softened. Add lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, bay leaf, and thyme. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until lentils are tender. Season with salt and pepper.

Press tofu to remove excess moisture, then cut into cubes. Stir-fry tofu until golden brown. Remove from pan. Stir-fry broccoli, sliced bell pepper, julienned carrot, snap peas, sliced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger in sesame oil. Add tofu back to the pan along with soy sauce. Cook until vegetables are tender-crisp.

Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Toss sliced bell peppers, sliced zucchini, halved cherry tomatoes, and thinly sliced red onion with minced garlic, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper. Roast in the oven until vegetables are tender. Serve over cooked quinoa and garnish with fresh basil.

Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. Add diced bell peppers and cook until tender. Stir in kidney beans, black beans, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, chili powder, cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper. Simmer until flavors are blended. Serve hot.

Recipe: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
Instructions: Remove stems from portobello mushrooms and brush with olive oil. Bake in the oven until tender. Sauté chopped spinach with minced garlic until wilted. Stir in crumbled feta cheese. Stuff spinach mixture into mushroom caps. Bake until heated through. Season with salt and pepper.

Press tofu to remove excess moisture, then cut into cubes. Sauté tofu in sesame oil until golden brown. Remove from pan. Stir-fry chopped broccoli, sliced carrots, sliced bell peppers, snap peas, sliced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger in sesame oil. Mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, cornstarch, and water to make a sauce. Add sauce and tofu back to the pan. Cook until vegetables are tender-crisp. Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a pie dish with pie crust. Sauté chopped spinach, diced bell peppers, sliced mushrooms, and diced onion until tender. Whisk together eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and a pinch of nutmeg. Stir in cooked vegetables and shredded cheddar cheese. Pour mixture into pie crust. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until set and golden brown.

Cook soba noodles according to package instructions. Rinse under cold water and drain. Toss cooked soba noodles with shelled edamame, julienned carrots, sliced cucumber, diced bell peppers, sliced green onions, and sesame seeds. Whisk together rice vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, honey, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Toss dressing with noodles and vegetables. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Warm corn tortillas in the microwave. Fill each tortilla with a mixture of black beans, corn, diced bell peppers, diced onion, and minced garlic. Roll up and place seam-side down in a baking dish. Pour enchilada sauce over the top. Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot with chopped cilantro, diced avocado, and a dollop of Greek yogurt.

Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Roast chickpeas and diced sweet potatoes in the oven until crispy. Steam broccoli and carrots until tender-crisp. Shred red cabbage. Assemble bowls with cooked quinoa, roasted chickpeas and sweet potatoes, steamed broccoli and carrots, shredded red cabbage, sliced avocado, and drizzle with tahini dressing. Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut bell peppers in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. Stir in cooked quinoa, drained black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Spoon mixture into bell pepper halves. Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until peppers are tender. Garnish with chopped cilantro.

Soak rice noodles in hot water until softened. Drain and set aside. Press tofu to remove excess moisture, then cut into cubes. Sauté tofu in a pan until golden brown. Push tofu to one side of the pan and crack eggs into the other side. Scramble eggs until cooked through, then mix with tofu. Add julienned carrots, bean sprouts, sliced green onions, and soaked rice noodles to the pan. Pour pad Thai sauce over the top and toss until heated through. Serve hot, garnished with chopped peanuts, cilantro, and lime wedges.

Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger in a pot until softened. Stir in diced tomatoes, drained chickpeas, coconut milk, curry powder, turmeric, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until flavors are blended and sauce thickens. Serve hot, garnished with chopped cilantro.

In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, diced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, thinly sliced red onion, pitted and halved kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss to coat. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In a large pot, sauté diced onion, minced garlic, chopped carrots, and diced celery until softened. Stir in cooked lentils, tomato paste, and vegetable broth. Simmer until mixture thickens. Add frozen peas and corn. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer lentil mixture to a baking dish. Spread mashed potatoes over the top. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until heated through and golden brown.

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Slice eggplant into rounds. Dip eggplant slices in beaten eggs, then coat in whole wheat breadcrumbs. Place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. In a baking dish, layer baked eggplant slices with tomato sauce, shredded mozzarella cheese, and grated Parmesan cheese. Sprinkle with garlic powder, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Repeat layers. Bake for an additional 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook lentils according to package instructions. Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, chopped carrots, and diced celery until softened. In a large bowl, combine cooked lentils, sautéed vegetables, beaten eggs, whole wheat breadcrumbs, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper. Transfer mixture to a greased loaf pan. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until firm and golden brown.

Pulse cauliflower florets in a food processor until they resemble rice grains. Sauté riced cauliflower, diced carrots, peas, diced bell peppers, and diced onion until tender. Push vegetables to one side of the pan and scramble eggs on the other side. Once eggs are cooked, mix with vegetables. Stir in soy sauce and sesame oil. Garnish with sliced scallions and sesame seeds before serving.

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut acorn squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Place squash halves cut-side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Roast for 30 minutes. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Sauté chopped kale, diced onion, and minced garlic in olive oil until kale is wilted. Stir in cooked quinoa, chopped pecans, dried cranberries, maple syrup, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Divide filling among roasted squash halves. Return to oven and bake for an additional 15 minutes or until squash is tender.

Rinse and drain black beans. Sauté diced bell peppers, diced onion, and minced garlic until softened. Stir in black beans, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Cook until heated through. Warm whole wheat tortillas. Fill tortillas with black bean mixture. Top with sliced avocado, salsa, Greek yogurt, and chopped cilantro.

In a large pot, sauté diced onion, minced garlic, chopped carrots, and diced celery until softened. Add rinsed lentils, vegetable broth, diced tomatoes, bay leaves, and thyme. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes or until lentils are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Remove stems from portobello mushrooms and brush with olive oil. Place mushrooms on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Top each mushroom with sliced tomatoes, fresh mozzarella cheese, and basil leaves. Drizzle with balsamic glaze. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes or until mushrooms are tender and cheese is melted.

In a bowl, mash chickpeas with a fork. Stir in diced celery, finely chopped red onion, chopped fresh parsley, lemon juice, Greek yogurt, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper. Spread chickpea salad onto whole grain bread slices. Top with lettuce, tomato, cucumber, and sliced avocado. Cover with another slice of bread to make a sandwich.

Using a spiralizer, turn zucchini into noodles. Sauté zucchini noodles and halved cherry tomatoes in olive oil until tender. In a food processor, blend basil leaves, pine nuts, minced garlic, grated Parmesan cheese, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper until smooth. Toss zucchini noodles with pesto sauce. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Thinly slice eggplant, zucchini, yellow squash, and bell peppers. Slice tomatoes and onion. Arrange sliced vegetables in a baking dish, alternating and overlapping them. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with herbes de Provence, salt, and pepper. Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes. Remove foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender and lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut tops off bell peppers and remove seeds. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. Stir in cooked quinoa, drained black beans, corn, and tomato sauce. Fill bell peppers with quinoa mixture. Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until peppers are tender. Garnish with chopped cilantro.

Cook lentils according to package instructions. Sauté diced bell peppers, diced onion, and minced garlic until softened. Stir in cooked lentils, chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Warm corn tortillas. Fill tortillas with lentil mixture. Top with shredded lettuce, diced tomato, sliced avocado, chopped cilantro, and a squeeze of lime juice.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions. Sauté chopped spinach and minced garlic until wilted. In a bowl, combine ricotta cheese, grated Parmesan cheese, beaten egg, and sautéed spinach. Spread a layer of marinara sauce in the bottom of a baking dish. Arrange cooked lasagna noodles on top. Spread ricotta mixture over noodles. Repeat layers, ending with marinara sauce. Top with shredded mozzarella cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In a food processor, blend chickpeas, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, ground cumin, ground coriander, salt, and pepper until mixture is smooth. Form mixture into balls and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Warm whole wheat pitas. Fill pitas with falafel, shredded lettuce, sliced tomato, sliced cucumber, and drizzle with tahini sauce.

Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Dice cucumber, halve cherry tomatoes, thinly slice red onion, and pit and halve kalamata olives. In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, diced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, thinly sliced red onion, pitted and halved kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss to coat. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Dice sweet potatoes and toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast in the oven until tender and caramelized. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Heat black beans on the stove. Steam broccoli until tender-crisp. Assemble bowls with cooked quinoa, roasted sweet potatoes, warmed black beans, sliced avocado, steamed broccoli, and drizzle with tahini dressing. Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut bell peppers in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. Stir in cooked quinoa, drained black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Spoon mixture into bell pepper halves. Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until peppers are tender. Garnish with chopped cilantro.

Soak rice noodles in hot water until softened. Drain and set aside. Press tofu to remove excess moisture, then cut into cubes. Sauté tofu in a pan until golden brown. Push tofu to one side of the pan and crack eggs into the other side. Scramble eggs until cooked through, then mix with tofu. Add julienned carrots, bean sprouts, sliced green onions, and soaked rice noodles to the pan. Pour pad Thai sauce over the top and toss until heated through. Serve hot, garnished with chopped peanuts, cilantro, and lime wedges.

Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger in a pot until softened. Stir in diced tomatoes, drained chickpeas, coconut milk, curry powder, turmeric, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve hot, garnished with chopped cilantro.

Cook lentils according to package instructions. Sauté diced carrots, diced celery, diced onion, and minced garlic until softened. Stir in cooked lentils, tomato sauce, dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes. Serve over cooked whole wheat spaghetti and garnish with grated Parmesan cheese.

In a pot, heat vegetable broth until simmering. In a separate pan, sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. Add Arborio rice to the pan and toast until lightly golden. Deglaze the pan with dry white wine and cook until absorbed. Gradually add hot vegetable broth to the rice, stirring constantly, until rice is creamy and cooked through. In another pan, sauté sliced mushrooms with thyme until golden brown. Stir cooked mushrooms, grated Parmesan cheese, and butter into the risotto. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut butternut squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Place squash halves cut-side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Roast for 45-50 minutes or until tender. Scoop out flesh from squash. Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in a pot until softened. Add roasted squash flesh, vegetable broth, coconut milk, maple syrup, curry powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes. Blend soup until smooth. Serve hot, garnished with toasted pumpkin seeds.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Thaw phyllo dough according to package instructions. Sauté chopped spinach, diced onion, and minced garlic until spinach is wilted. In a bowl, mix together cooked spinach, crumbled feta cheese, beaten eggs, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Brush phyllo dough sheets with melted butter and layer them in a baking dish, brushing each layer with butter. Spread spinach and feta mixture evenly over phyllo dough. Fold edges over the filling. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown and crispy.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Remove stems from mushrooms and finely chop. Sauté chopped mushroom stems, minced garlic, and chopped spinach until spinach is wilted. In a bowl, mix together sautéed mixture, softened cream cheese, grated Parmesan cheese, panko breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper. Stuff mushroom caps with filling. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.

Soak rice noodles in hot water until softened. Drain and set aside. Julienne bell peppers and carrots, and chop snap peas and green onions. In a bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, maple syrup, minced garlic, grated ginger, and red pepper flakes. Toss cooked rice noodles with peanut sauce and chopped vegetables until well coated. Serve hot, garnished with chopped cilantro and peanuts.

Rinse and drain black beans. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Sauté diced bell peppers, diced onion, and minced garlic until softened. In a food processor, pulse black beans until mashed but still chunky. In a bowl, combine mashed black beans, cooked quinoa, sautéed vegetables, beaten egg, whole wheat breadcrumbs, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. Form mixture into patties. Cook patties in a skillet over medium heat until golden brown on both sides. Serve on whole wheat burger buns with lettuce, tomato, and sliced avocado.

Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Slice baguette into rounds and place on a baking sheet. Toast in the oven for 5-7 minutes or until lightly golden. Dice tomatoes and chop fresh basil. In a bowl, mix together diced tomatoes, chopped basil, minced garlic, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper. Spoon tomato mixture onto toasted baguette slices. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta according to package instructions. Dice cucumber, halve cherry tomatoes, thinly slice red onion, and pit and halve kalamata olives. In a large bowl, combine cooked pasta, diced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, thinly sliced red onion, pitted and halved kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss to coat. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.

Cook lentils according to package instructions. Sauté diced onion, diced bell peppers, and minced garlic until softened. Stir in cooked lentils, tomato sauce, ketchup, brown sugar, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes. Serve hot on toasted whole wheat hamburger buns.

Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut tops off bell peppers and remove seeds. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. Stir in cooked quinoa, drained black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Spoon mixture into bell pepper halves. Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until peppers are tender. Garnish with chopped cilantro.

Cook lentils according to package instructions. Sauté diced bell peppers, diced onion, and minced garlic until softened. Stir in cooked lentils, chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Warm corn tortillas. Fill tortillas with lentil mixture. Top with shredded lettuce, diced tomato, sliced avocado, chopped cilantro, and a squeeze of lime juice.

Ingredients: Quinoa, Bell peppers, Onion, Garlic, Tomato sauce, Black beans, Corn, Cumin, Chili powder, Salt, Pepper, Cilantro, Shredded cheese (optional)
Instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove seeds. In a skillet, sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. Add tomato sauce, black beans, corn, cooked quinoa, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes. Stuff the mixture into bell peppers. Place stuffed peppers in a baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes. Optional: top with shredded cheese during the last 5 minutes of baking. Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.
